oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Quantifizierung des Stickstoffs in Wurzeln und Wurzelausscheidungen von Soja
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schweiger, Peter
Hofer, Michaela
Vollmann, Johann
Wanek, Wolfgang
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: "Organics" in general
Crop husbandry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The below ground N allocation of organic soybean was examined in two experiments conducted in Eastern Austria. During early development, individual soybean plants were labelled with a 15N-enriched urea solution by the petiole-feeding method. The 15N enrichment of these plants and surrounding soil relative to their natural 15N abundance was determined at plant maturity. The proportion of soil N derived from roots was calculated from root and soil N isotope data. Total below ground plant N, including rhizodeposits, amounted to between 6 to 48 % of total plant N. The proportion of total plant N allocated below ground was inversely related to shoot N content.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schweiger, Peter; Hofer, Michaela; Vollmann, Johann and Wanek, Wolfgang (2013) Quantifizierung des Stickstoffs in Wurzeln und Wurzelausscheidungen von Soja. Paper at: 12. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität, Bonn, 5. bis 8. März 2013.
